metadata.title: CVE-2020-6537 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Type confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 84.0.4147.105 allowed aremote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a craftedHTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0.4147.105-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
